result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew P. Mueller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office. 

Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent;

 AODA and follow up; 

DNA sample. 

Reserves ruling on eligibility for programming. 

64 days credit if revoked.

No contact with victims; 

Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and controlled substances, unless prescribed and to only be taken as prescribed;

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

9:15 a.m.
Clerk Micki.
INCLUDES 22CF950, 22CF1083, 22CM469, 22CM470, and 22CM730.

State appears by DDA Molly Lawrence; Defendant appears in person, in custody from the MCJ, with Attorney Peter Vu.

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW.
COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding.

COURT notes Defendant is competent to proceed.
Atty Vu does not wish to contest the competency report. 

22CF950
Waiver of Prelim. filed; COURT questions deft as to waiver.
COURT finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial. 
Information will be e-filed; Reading Waived; R/J. 

State moves to: 
22CF950
AMEND COUNT 1: 943.10(2)(a) Burglary Army w/Dangerous Weapon to 943.10(1m)(a) Burglary. 
COUNT 2: Bail Jumping - Misd. >> DRI. 
COUNT 3: Bail Jumping - Misd. >> DRI.
22CF1083
COUNT 1: Bail Jumping - Fel. >> DRI. 
COUNT 2: Bail Jumping - Misd. >> DRI.
COUNT 3: Bail Jumping - Misd. >> DRI.
COUNT 4: Bail Jumping - Misd. >> DRI.
22CM469
COUNT 2: Possession of THC >> DRI.
COUNT 3: Possess Drug Paraphernalia >> DRI.
22CM730
COUNT 2: Bail Jumping - Misd. >> DRI.
COUNT 3: Bail Jumping - Misd. >> DRI.

COURT GRANTS.

PLEA to: 
22CF950
AMENDED COUNT 1: 943.10(1m)(a) Burglary >> NO CONTEST.
22CM469
COUNT 1: Resisting or Obstructing an Officer >> NO CONTEST.
22CM470
COUNT 1: Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$2500) >> NO CONTEST.
22CM730
COUNT 1: Public Fornication >> NO CONTEST. 

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis & defendant guilty.

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 6 years probation on felony count in 22CF950 and SWH for 2 years probation on all misdemeanor counts (all counts to run concurrent to each other); CONDITIONS: Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent; AODA and f/u; No contact with victims; Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and controlled substances, unless prescribed and to only be taken as prescribed; CC; and DNA sample and surcharge. Reserves ruling on eligibility for programming. 

If revoked:
22CF1083 40 days credit.
22CF950 64 days credit.
22CM730 64 days credit.
22CM469 66 days credit.
22CM470 66 days credit.
